study_info.title: A New MEN2 Syndrome with Clinical Features of Both MEN2A and MEN2B Associated with a New RET Germline Deletion

cohort_info.sporadic_definition_criteria: Case described as carrying a de novo RET germline deletion not detected in the blood of the parents or brother, indicating absence of familial transmission.

biochemical_data.context: Pre-referral local measurement described as 665 pg/ml Ct with thyroid nodules.
Baseline at referral to endocrine unit before thyroid surgery.

biochemical_data.reference_range: 8-18 ng/L (upper limit 18 ng/L for Ct reported separately from PTH range)

biochemical_data.context: Initial detection at 7 years of age triggering evaluation for hyperparathyroidism.
Initial PTH when calcium 11.3 mg/dl at 7 years.
Hypercalcemia at presentation to endocrine unit with MTC.
PTH at same time as calcium 11.2 mg/dL and Ct 496 ng/L.
Calcium on calcitriol therapy two months after surgery.
PTH two months after surgery while on calcitriol.

imaging: Neck ultrasound at 7 years: bilateral solid hypoechoic thyroid micronodules; left roundish hypoechoic extrathyroid lesion of 9 mm suspected lymphadenopathy or hyperplastic parathyroid; latero-cervical lymphadenopathies.

Neck ultrasound preoperatively: three bilateral micronodules, suspicious left solid hypoechoic thyroid nodule 11 mm with irregular margin; 9 mm hypoechoic nodular lesion below left lobe suspected hyperplastic parathyroid; multiple jugular and left latero-cervical microlymphadenopathies.
Total body CT scan: excluded distant metastases; showed megacolon.

Pelvic MRI at age 2 and follow-up: large pelvic solid expansive lesion 14 cm extending to pubic region around urethra and bladder causing mild hydronephrosis; described as stable over time, consistent with plexiform neurofibroma.
Gastrointestinal scintigraphy at age 2: slowed gastric emptying.
Gastroscopy: irregular small duodenum with esophagitis.
Abdominal CT and MRI eight months after surgery: no metastatic lesions, stability of pelvic mass.
pathology: Thyroid: multifocal bilateral medullary thyroid carcinoma; four microfoci (three left lobe, one right lobe); largest focus approximately 1 cm in left lobe; associated C-cell hyperplasia.

Tumor invasion: largest microfocus invaded perithyroid soft tissue with extensive neoplastic lymphangiosis and vascular embolization; neoplastic vascular emboli and deposits infiltrating adjacent ganglioneuromatosis lesion.
Lymph nodes: central compartment 5/10 positive, left latero-cervical 5/32 positive for MTC metastases.
Parathyroid: one hyperplastic parathyroid (6 mm) and one parathyroid adenoma (8 mm).
Mucosal neuromas: histology consistent with diffuse ganglioneuromatosis of oral mucosa.

Pelvic lesion: plexiform neurofibroma with diffuse ganglioneuromatosis involving bladder wall; S100-positive spindle cells; ganglion-like cells positive for synaptophysin and neuron specific enolase; EMA-positive perineurial cells around fascicles.

family_history.notes: Parents and brother tested negative for the RET germline deletion; no familial MEN2 features reported.

surgery: Bilateral neck exploration for primary hyperparathyroidism with removal of hyperplastic parathyroid and parathyroid adenoma.
Biopsy of mucosal neuromas of the mouth.
Prior laparotomy at age 2 for debulking of unresectable pelvic mass (plexiform neurofibroma).
follow_up: Two months post-thyroidectomy: serum calcitonin 52 ng/L, calcium 9.5 mg/dl on calcitriol 0.25 μg/day, PTH 21 ng/L, B-ALP 75 μg/L, osteocalcin 79.4 μg/L; neck ultrasound showed no local recurrence.
Eight months post-thyroidectomy: CT and abdominal MRI confirmed absence of metastatic lesions and stability of pelvic mass; serum calcitonin and CEA reported as stable (values not specified).
Continued urological follow-up for vesicoureteral reflux and bladder involvement by plexiform neurofibroma.

methods.sequencing_panel: Germline RET analysis by Sanger sequencing of genomic DNA amplified by PCR; next-generation sequencing panel used for primary MTC tumor, neck lymph node metastasis, and plexiform neurofibroma to search for additional somatic mutations.
methods.biomarker_assays: Serum calcitonin, calcium, and PTH measured with routine hospital assays (exact platforms not specified); bone-specific alkaline phosphatase, osteocalcin, metanephrines, and 25-hydroxyvitamin D also measured with standard methods.
